arts.ttl: Newcastle can't hide horror as Crystal Palace and Marc Guehi go wild
arts.sum: Marc Guehi put through his own net to give Newcastle the lead in the 53rd minute, following a well-worked free-kick, but Daniel Munoz's header secured Crystal Palace a deserved point right at the death at Selhurst Park. Marc Guehi, keen to make amends for his own goal, launched the ball forward and found Ismaila Sarr inside the box just after the hour mark and Nick Pope made a huge save to deny the Crystal Palace danger man with his shoulder.

arts.ttl: 'He will not leave': President promises West Ham and Newcastle will not sign 27-goal striker
Real Madrid target admits he's keen on Newcastle switch, wants to join 'miracle player' on Tyneside
arts.sum: Newcastle have already signed one wonderkid...

arts.ttl: Munoz makes amends for misses to secure late draw for Palace
arts.sum: Despite Sarr’s pressure, he could not find a way past Newcastle’s goalkeeper, and even as Justin Devenny, who scored his first Premier League goal against Aston Villa last week was introduced along with Eddie Nketiah, it looked like Palace would draw another blank – until Munoz’s late intervention, that is. It looked like Newcastle – humbled at home by West Ham United on Monday – would return to winning ways after Guehi bundled Anthony Gordon’s low cross into his own net 53 minutes in.

arts.ttl: Late goal was 'gutting' to concede - Howe
arts.sum: Eddie Howe says it was "gutting" to concede after Newcastle were denied three points by a late Crystal Palace equaliser.
Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner says his side "deserved" to win despite needing a late goal from Daniel Munoz to secure a 1-1 draw against Newcastle United.

arts.ttl: Late goal was 'gutting' to concede - Howe
arts.sum: Eddie Howe says it was "gutting" to concede a goal after Newcastle were denied three points by a late Crystal Palace equaliser.

arts.ttl: The lowdown on Crystal Palace 1 Newcastle 1 - Munoz rescues point as Eagles move out of bottom three ahead of crucial Ipswich clash
arts.sum: Daniel Munoz scored in the 93rd minute to rescue a point for Crystal Palace in a 1-1 draw with Newcastle on Saturday. Daniel Munoz should have given the Eagles the lead in the 35th minute after a wonderful team move on the counter-attack when Ismaila Sarr pulled the ball to the back post for the Colombian defender to attack.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace boss explains Eberechi Eze substitution in Newcastle draw with Ipswich up next
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner admitted he always wanted to bring Eberechi Eze off in the 65th minute as he steps up his recovery from injury in Crystal Palace’s 1-1 draw with Newcastle on Saturday. But Glasner took the England international off with the Eagles 1-0 down, with youngster Justin Devenny coming on.
Oliver Glasner feels Crystal Palace’s outstanding supporters deserved the delight which accompanied Daniel Muñoz’s 94th-minute equaliser against Newcastle United at Selhurst Park.
